definition[0]: a piece of metal, usually flat and round, that is used as money
definition[1]: money in the form of metal coins
definition[2]: to invent a new word or expression, especially one that many people start to use
example[0]: The word ‘aromatherapy’ was coined in the 1920s.
definition[3]: to make pieces of money from metal
example[1]: Since the introduction of the £1 coin, the smallest English note is £5.
definition[4]: to earn a lot of money very quickly
example[3]: Top footballers have been coining it in for years.
